definitions.definition: Occurring for no particular reason; haphazard , unpredictable .
examples: Our city is plagued by random acts of violence.
random acts of kindness

definitions.definition: Involving an outcome which is impossible to predict, but which may be represented by a probability distribution ; in the ideal case, involving outcomes which are equally likely .
examples: The flip of a fair coin is purely random .
The newspaper conducted a random sample of five hundred American teenagers.
The results of the field survey look random by several different measures.
A toss of a loaded die is still random , though biased.

definitions.definition: Pseudorandom ; mimicking the result of random selection.
examples: The rand function generates a random number from a seed.

definitions.definition: Selected for no particular reason; arbitrary ; unspecified .
examples: A random American off the street couldn't tell the difference.
You're just going to trust the word of random people on the Internet?
I didn't have time to peruse the resturant's menu, so I just ordered some random dish.
Whatever random hobby you're into, there's an Internet community for it.

definitions.definition: Being (part of) a varied , unrelated , and apparently arbitrary collection of things; diverse , heterogeneous .
examples: My notebook has turned into a random collection of thoughts.
I brought a bunch of random snacks, but nothing nutritious.
I mixed a bunch of random vegetables into a salad, and it actually turned out pretty good.

definitions.definition: Apropos of nothing ; lacking context , relevance , or any connection to the previous situation; unexpected .
examples: This random guy just came up to me to say that he was a fan of my work.
Thank you for that completely random comment... now, let's get back to our actual topic of discussion.
The teacher's bartending story was interesting, but very random .
I feel like pineapple is a very random thing to put on a pizza.

definitions.definition: Of a person: characterized by or often saying random things; habitually using non sequiturs .
examples: You're so random ! I never know what you're going to do next.

definitions.definition: Being out of the ordinary ; unusual or unexpected ; odd , strange , bizarre .
examples: That's a rather random fact!
I can't believe he would say that. That's so random !

main_definition: Occurring for no particular reason; haphazard , unpredictable .
secondary_definitions: ( statistics ) Involving an outcome which is impossible to predict, but which may be represented by a probability distribution ; in the ideal case, involving outcomes which are equally likely .
( computing ) Pseudorandom ; mimicking the result of random selection.
( informal ) Selected for no particular reason; arbitrary ; unspecified .
( informal ) Being (part of) a varied , unrelated , and apparently arbitrary collection of things; diverse , heterogeneous .
( informal ) Apropos of nothing ; lacking context , relevance , or any connection to the previous situation; unexpected .
( informal ) Of a person: characterized by or often saying random things; habitually using non sequiturs .
( UK , slang ) Being out of the ordinary ; unusual or unexpected ; odd , strange , bizarre .
